intro: Schkuhria bonariensis, commonly known as the Buenos Aires dandelion, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of soft, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Schkuhria bonariensis is often found in disturbed soils and open areas, thriving in temperate climates. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
